channel.title: Anyone know whats wrong with my outstream?
channel.description:
if (!nonWild()) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("null"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } else { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(1); outStream.writeString("@dre@Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); }
Problem: The option to attack players is visible no matter where you stand, wild or non wild. Solution attempts: I've tried switching the code around, trying other codes, even trying to make my own code by making a IsInWilderness = true/false; statement.. nothing seems to work! Can anyone help out with whats going on? It seems to ignore the else statement, I've tried else if statements.. I've done all kinds of things. No luck.

item.title: Anyone know whats wrong with my outstream?
item.dc:creator: @Lord_Fox Lord Fox
item.description:
@Lord_Fox wrote:

if (!nonWild()) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("null"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); } else { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(1); outStream.writeString("@dre@Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); }
Problem: The option to attack players is visible no matter where you stand, wild or non wild. Solution attempts: I've tried switching the code around, trying other codes, even trying to make my own code by making a IsInWilderness = true/false; statement.. nothing seems to work!

Can anyone help out with whats going on? It seems to ignore the else statement, I’ve tried else if statements… I’ve done all kinds of things. No luck.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know whats wrong with my outstream?
